authentication.title: Vurdering av personvernkonsekvenser
authentication.subtitle1:
Et program for å opprette
og administrere DPIA
authentication.description: Denne programvaren fra den franske databeskyttelsesmyndigheten (CNIL) er ment å hjelpe databehandlingsansvarlig å behandle personopplysninger i overenstemmelse med GDPR. Programvaren er ment som en hjelp i vurderingen av personvernkonsekvenser (DPIA) gjennom å fasilitere for bruk av PIA-metodikken utviklet av CNIL.

languages.cnil_translations: TO BE TRANSLATED - CNIL provided translations
languages.community_translations: TO BE TRANSLATED - Community provided translations

filters.name: Navn
filters.author: Forfatter
filters.list_rocket_content:
Kom i gang ! For å starte
en DPIA, klikk på +
filters.card_rocket_content:
Kom i gang !

For å starte en DPIA,
klikk på Ny DPIA

evaluation.title: Venter på revisjon.
evaluation.content: Denne delen er ikke ennå ikke blitt revidert. Hvis du ønsker å endre innholdet sendt for revisjon må du

validation.title: Be om revisjon.
validation.content: Denne delen har blitt revidert og avventer en helhetlig DPIA godkjenning. Hvis du ønsker å ender revidert del,må du

measures.add: Legg til et tomt mål (eller, bruk kunnskapsbasen)
measures.default_placeholder: Beskriv de eksisterende eller tiltenkte mål for å oppnå tilstrekkelig informasjonssikkerhet.

knowledge_base.title: Kunnskapsbase
knowledge_base.add_measure_hint: Du kan også legge til et mål fra kunnskapsbasen.

PIA_LGL_FOND.name: Behandlingens lovlighet
PIA_LGL_FOND.description:
Den registrerte har gitt samtykke til behandling av sine personopplysninger for ett eller flere spesifikke formål
- Behandlingen er nødvendig for å oppfylle en avtale som den registrerte er part i, eller for å gjennomføre tiltak på den registrertes anmodning før en avtaleinngåelse
- Behandlingen er nødvendig for å oppfylle en rettslig forpliktelse som påhviler den behandlingsansvarlige
- Behandlingen er nødvendig for å verne den registrertes eller en annen fysisk persons vitale interesser
- Behandlingen er nødvendig for å utføre en oppgave i allmennhetens interesse eller utøve offentlig myndighet som den behandlingsansvarlige er pålagt
- Behandlingen er nødvendig for formål knyttet til de berettigede interessene som forfølges av den behandlingsansvarlige eller en tredjepart, med mindre den registrertes interesser eller grunnleggende rettigheter og friheter går foran og krever vern av personopplysninger, særlig dersom den registrerte er et barn
Se art. 6 i [GDPR]

PIA_LGL_ST.name: Underleverandører
PIA_LGL_ST.description: Det må inngås en databehandleravtale med hver enkelt databehandler, som omfatter alle forholdene i artikkel 28 i personvernforordningen: lengde, omfang, formål, dokumenterte instukser for behandling, rutiner for forhåndsgodkjenning av underleverandører, dokumentasjon som viser samsvar med personvernforordningen, rask informasjon om avviksmeldinger osv.

PIA_LGL_TRAN.name: Overføring av personopplysninger
PIA_LGL_TRAN.description:
Uavhengig av hvilket land virskomheten er lokalisert i, må du begrunne valg av ekstern hosting og angi lovpålagte tilsynsordninger som er implementert for å sikre beskyttelse av den registrerte ved overføring til utlandet. Det er:
- Land i EU
- Land som er annerkjent av EU for å ha tilstrekkelig beskyttelse
- Overføring til USA til virksomheter som er tilsluttet Privacy Shield
- Andre land
Se art. 44 til 49 i [GDPR]

PIA_LGL_DESC.name: Beskrivelse av behandling
PIA_LGL_DESC.description: Gi en kort oversikt over behandlingen som vurderes, dens art, omfang, formål, sammenheng, og interessenter. Identifiser behandlingsansvarlig og databhenadler(e). Oppgi standardhenvisninger som gjelder for behandlingen, og som er nødvendige eller må overholdes, inkludert atferdsnormer. (se artikkel 40 i [GDPR]) og sertifisering med hensyn til personvern (se artikkel 42 i [GDPR])

PIA_LGL_DATA.name: Personopplysninger som behandles
PIA_LGL_DATA.description:
Definer og beskriv omfanget i detalj:
- type personopplysniger, mottakere og lagringstid
- beskriv behandlingen og støtteprosesser i hele livssyklusen for personopplysningene (fra innsamling til sletting).

PIA_LGL_SUPT.name: Støtteprosesser
PIA_LGL_SUPT.description: Støtteprosesser som personopplysningene er avhengig av. Merk: Dette kan være maskinvare, programvare, nettverk, mennesker, papir eller ulike alternativer for overføring.

PIA_LGL_FIN.name: Prisipper relatert til behandling av personopplysninger
PIA_LGL_FIN.description:
Personopplysninger skal samles inn for spesifikke, uttrykkelig angitte og berettigede formål og ikke viderebehandles på en måte som er uforenlig med formålet.
See Art. 5.1 b) of [GDPR]

PIA_LGL_MINI.name: Dataminimering
PIA_LGL_MINI.description: Personopplysninger skal være adekvate, relevante og begrenset til det som er nødvendig for formålene (ellers skal de ikke samles inn). Ved minimalisering av antall og omfang av personopplysninger, bidrar man til å redusere høy risiko for de registrertes rettigheter og friheter. Dataminimalisering betyr også agregering av personopplysniger, eller å velge personopplysninger som ikke faller inn under særlig kategorier (artikkel 9).

PIA_LGL_DEST.name: Mottaker
PIA_LGL_DEST.description: «Mottaker» en fysisk eller juridisk person, offentlig myndighet, institusjon eller ethvert annet organ som personopplysninger utleveres til, enten det dreier seg om en tredjepart eller ikke. Offentlige myndigheter som kan motta personopplysninger innenfor rammen av en særskilt undersøkelse i samsvar med unionsretten eller medlemsstatenes nasjonale rett, skal imidlertid ikke anses som mottakere; nevnte offentlige myndigheters behandling av slike opplysninger skal være i samsvar med gjeldende regler om vern av personopplysninger i henhold til formålet med behandlingen. Se art. 4.9 i [GDPR]

PIA_LGL_DUR.name: Lagringsbegrensning
PIA_LGL_DUR.description: Personopplysninger skal lagres slik at det ikke er mulig å identifisere de registrerte i lengre perioder enn det som er nødvendig for formålet som personopplysningene behandles for; personopplysninger kan lagres i lengre perioder dersom de utelukkende vil bli behandlet for arkivformål i allmennhetens interesse, for formål knyttet til vitenskapelig eller historisk forskning eller for statistiske formål i samsvar med artikkel 89 nr. 1, forutsatt at det gjennomføres egnede tekniske og organisatoriske tiltak som kreves i henhold til denne forordningen for å sikre de registrertes rettigheter og friheter

PIA_LGL_INFO.name: Informasjon til de registrerte
PIA_LGL_INFO.description: Vær sikker på at den registrerte er tilstrekkelig informert om behandlingen som gjøres av hans/hennes opplysninger. Dokumenter dersom behandlingen som utføres er dekket av et unntak eller er underlagt andre spesifikke forhold.

PIA_LGL_CONS.name: Samtykke
PIA_LGL_CONS.description: Tillat de registrerte ta fri, spesifikke og informerte valg. Avgjør om behandlingen er basert på et annet rettslig grunnlag enn samtykke, ref. art. 6 i [GDPR]

PIA_VAL_DPO.name: Personvernombudets synspunkter
PIA_VAL_DPO.description:
Den behandlingsansvarlige skal rådføre seg med personvernombudet, dersom et personvernombud er utpekt, i forbindelse med utførelsen av en vurdering av personvernkonsekvenser. Se art. 39.2 i [GDPR]
Synspunktet kan være i mot behandlingen som skal gjennomføres, uten å begrense avgjørelsen for behandlingsansvarlig. .
PIA_VAL_DPO.source: GDPR Art. 39.2 and PIAF Connected Objects p37

PIA_VAL_CONC.name: Den registrertes synspunkter
PIA_VAL_CONC.description:
Dersom det er relevant, skal den behandlingsansvarlige innhente synspunkter på den planlagte behandlingen fra de registrerte eller deres representanter uten at det berører vernet av kommersielle eller allmenne interesser eller sikkerheten ved behandlingsaktivitetene. Se art. 39.2 of the [GDPR]
Synspunktene kan være i mot behandlingen, avhenging av sammenhengen (intern eller ekstern forskning på behandlingsmetodikk eller formål, spørsmål rettet til ansattrepresentanter eller fagforeninger, undersøkelser gjort av databehadnlerens kommende kunder). Der behandlingsansvarlige bestemmer seg for ikke ta hensyn til den registrertes synspunkter , må han/hun dokumentere begrunnelsen for denne avgjørelsen. Om behandlingsansvarlige bestemmer seg for å at innsamling av de registrertes synspunkter ikke er relevant, må han/hun også dokumentere begrunnelsen for denne beslutningen.
PIA_VAL_CONC.source: GDPR Art. 39.9 and PIAF Connected Objects p38

PIA_VAL_RT.name: Formell godkjenning
PIA_VAL_RT.description:
Avgjør om de utvalgte tiltak, restrisiko og handlingsplan er akseptabel med hensyn til den registrertes acceptable, begrunn med hensyn til tidligere interessenter og synspunkter til interessenter. Slik kan DPIA være:
- godkjent
- gjenstand for forbedringer (forklar hvor og hvorfor)
- avvist (sammen med behandlingen som vurderes). Gjenta om nødvendig tidligere steg slik at DPIA kan godkjennes. Denne beslutningen er ikke til hinder for at tilsynsmyndigheter (Datatilsynet i Norge) kan overprøve om gjennomføringen av vurderingen er i samsvar regelverket, som ledd av formaliteter, kontroller, tilsyn osv.

PIA_TEC_CHIF.placeholder: Beskriv tiltakene som er implementert for å ivareta konfidensialitet av personopplysningene
PIA_TEC_CHIF.name: Kryptering
PIA_TEC_CHIF.description:
Tiltak implementert for å sikre konfidensialitet av lagrede personopplysninger (i databasen, flate filer, backup-er, osv.), prosedyrer for nøkkelhåndtering (generere, lagre, endre i tilfeler der man mistenker at personopplysninger er komprimittert osv.).
Beskriv anvendelsen av krypteringstiltakene for dataflyt (VPN, TLS, osv.) implementert i behandlingen.

PIA_TEC_ANO.name: Anonymisering
PIA_TEC_ANO.description:
Angi her om anonymiseringsteknikker er implementert, hvilke og for hvilket formål.
Husk å skille mellom anonyme og pseudonyme opplysninger.

PIA_TEC_CLO.placeholder: Angi her om partisjonering av behandlingen er planlagt, og hvordan det utføres.
PIA_TEC_CLO.name: Partitioning data
PIA_TEC_CLO.description: Implementering av datapartisjonering bidrar til å redusere muligheten for at personopplysninger kan kobles og at det kan oppstå brudd/avvik relatert til alle personopplysningene.

PIA_TEC_CTLA.placeholder: Angi her hvordan brukerprofiler defineres og tilordnes.
PIA_TEC_CTLA.name: Teknisk tilgangskontroll
PIA_TEC_CTLA.description: Metodikk for å definere og tilordne brukerprofiler. Spesifiser authentication tiltak som er implementert. Om relevant, spesifiser regler for passord (minimum lengde/antall tegn, krav til tegn, gyldighet/lengde, antall feilforsøk før kontoen stenges, osv.).

PIA_TEC_LOG.placeholder: Angi her om hendelser blir logget og hvor lenge disse loggene er lagret.
PIA_TEC_LOG.name: Sporbarhet (logging)
PIA_TEC_LOG.description: Prosedyrer og rutiner for sporbarhet og håndtering av logger.

PIA_TEC_ARCH.placeholder: Angi her om det er implemntert tiltak for å sikre integriteten på lagring av personopplysninger og monitorering av integritetsbudd, hvilke og med hvilket formål.
PIA_TEC_ARCH.name: Arkivering
PIA_TEC_ARCH.description: Beskriv prosedyrer og rutiner for arkivering av personopplysninger (leveranse, lagring, konsulering, osv.) som du er ansvarlig for. Spesifiser arkiveringsroller (hvor personopplysningene oppstår, hvor de overføres, osv.) og arkiverings-policy. Avgjør om opplysningene faller inn under offentleglova.

PIA_TEC_PAP.placeholder: Gi en indikasjon på om det er innført prosedyrer for integritetsovervåkning av papirdokumenter, for hvilke dokumenter og hva formålet er.
PIA_TEC_PAP.name: Sikkerhet for papirdokumenter
PIA_TEC_PAP.description: Om papirdokumenter som inneholder persondata blir brukt i behandlingen, gi en kort beskrivelse av hvordan de er skrevet ut, makulert, sendt eller utvekslet.

PIA_TEC_MINI.placeholder: Gi en indikasjon på hvilke tiltak som er innført for å redusere risikograden gjennom å begrense mengden av personopplysninger
PIA_TEC_MINI.name: Begrense mengden av personopplysninger
PIA_TEC_MINI.description: Følgende metodene kan brukes: filtrering og sletting, redusere følsomheten, redusere identifiserende elementer i dataene, redusere akkumulering av data, begrense tilgangen til dataene

PIA_SEC_EXP.placeholder: Beskriv hvordan programvare oppdateres (operativsystemer, programvare, etc.) og hvordan sikkerhetsoppdateringer ivaretas.
PIA_SEC_EXP.name: Operativ sikkerhet
PIA_SEC_EXP.description: Prosedyrer som er innført for å redusere muligheten for å og konsekvenser av risiko i støttesystemer som behandler personopplysninger.

PIA_SEC_MAL.placeholder: Beskriv her hvilke kontrolltiltak som er innført for å redusere risiko ved tilkobling til mindre sikre nettverk.
PIA_SEC_MAL.name: Beskyttelse mot ødeleggende programvare
PIA_SEC_MAL.description: Kontrolltiltak innført på arbeidssituasjoner og servere for å beskytte dem mot ødeleggende programvare ved oppkobling mot mindre sikre nettverk.

PIA_SEC_COMP.placeholder: Beskriv her hvilke tiltak som er innført på arbeidsstasjoner
PIA_SEC_COMP.name: Administrere arbeidsstasjoner
PIA_SEC_COMP.description: Tiltak innført på arbeidsstasjoner (automatisk låsing, jevnlige oppdateringer, konfigurering, fysisk sikkerhet, etc.) for å redusere muligheten for at ødeleggende programvare utnytter egenskapene til operativsystemer, programvare, etc. for negativ utnyttelse eller påvirkning av personopplysninger.

PIA_SEC_WEB.placeholder: Gi en kort beskrivelse av hvilke kontrolltiltak som er innført for å beskytte nettsider.
PIA_SEC_WEB.name: Sikkerhet på nettsider
PIA_SEC_WEB.description: Innføring av NSMs anbefalinger for sikring av nettsider.

PIA_SEC_BKP.placeholder: Gi en kort beskrivelse av hvordan backup gjennomføres og administreres. Vær tydelig på om backup oppbevares på et sikkert sted eller ikke.
PIA_SEC_BKP.name: Backup
PIA_SEC_BKP.description: Prosedyrer og tiltak som er innført for å sikre tilgjengelighet og/eller integriteten til personopplysninger samtidig som konfidensialiteten bevares.
PIA_SEC_BKP.source: PIAF Connected Objects p23 & PIA3 p27  - WIKI

PIA_SEC_MAIN.placeholder: Beskriv håndteringen av fysisk vedlikehold av maskinvare
PIA_SEC_MAIN.name: Vedlikehold
PIA_SEC_MAIN.description:
Prosedyrer og rutiner for fysisk vedlikehold av maskinvare, om dette er outsourcet.
Angi om remote vedlikehold av apper er autorisert og i henhold til hvilke ordninger. Spesifiser hvordan deffekt utstyr håndteres eventuelt kasseres.

PIA_SEC_NET.placeholder: Gi en kort beskrivelse over hvilke kontrolltiltak som er på nettverket hvor databehandlingen finner sted
PIA_SEC_NET.name: Nettverkssikkerhet
PIA_SEC_NET.description: Avhengig av type nettverk hvor databehandlingen finner sted (isolert, privat eller internett), spesifiser hvilke typer brannmurer, IDS (intrusion detection systems) og eventuelt andre aktive eller passive enheter som benyttes for å sikre nettverket.

PIA_SEC_PHY.placeholder: Gi en kort beskrivelse av hvordan det fysiske adgangskontrollsystemet til lokasjonen hvor databehandlingen finner sted fungerer.
PIA_SEC_PHY.name: Fysisk adgangskontroll
PIA_SEC_PHY.description: Hvilke prosedyrer finnes for å sikre fysisk sikkerhet til lokasjonen (ulike soner, eskortering av besøkende, synlige gjestekort, låste dører og lignende). Er det utarbeidet prosedyrer for varsling ved innbrudd?.

PIA_SEC_LOG.placeholder: Gi en kort beskrivelse over hvilke tiltak og kontroller som er innført for å oppdage hendelser knyttet til personopplysninger
PIA_SEC_LOG.name: Overvåkning av nettverksaktivitet
PIA_SEC_LOG.description: Overvåker med IDS (intrusion detection systems) og IPS (intrusion prevention systems) for å analysere nettverkstrafikk i sanntid (kablet nettverk, trådløst nettverk, radiobølger, fiberoptikk, etc.) for å oppdage mistenkelig aktivitet som indikerer angrep.

PIA_SEC_MAT.placeholder: Gi en kort beskrivelse over hvilke kontrolltiltak som er innført for fysisk sikring av serverer og arbeidsstasjoner
PIA_SEC_MAT.name: Fysisk sikring av datautstyr
PIA_SEC_MAT.description: Gi en kort beskrivelse over hvilke kontrolltiltak som er innført for fysisk sikring av serverer og arbeidsstasjoner (sikker oppbevaring,  lagring, kabling, konfidensialitetsfiltre, sikker sletting av data før makulering av disker og andre lagringsmedier og lignende).

PIA_SEC_SRC.placeholder: Beskriv om lokasjonen er utsatt for miljøkatastofer.
PIA_SEC_SRC.name: Unngå risikokilder
PIA_SEC_SRC.description: Prosedyrer som beskriver tiltak for å beskytte mot, oppdage og bekjempe brann. Om det er aktuelt, beskriv tiltak for å hinder vannskader på grunn av flom eller oversvømmelse, samt tiltak ved strømbrudd.

PIA_SEC_PROT.placeholder: Angi tiltak for å unngå eller begrense ikke-menneskelige kilder til risiko.
PIA_SEC_PROT.name: Beskyttelse mot ikke-menneskelige kilder til risiko
PIA_SEC_PROT.description: Policies describing the means of fire prevention, detection and fighting. Where applicable, indicate the means of preventing water damage.Also specify the means of power supply monitoring and relief.

PIA_ORG_ORG.placeholder: Gi en kort beskrivelse om roller og ansvar for datasikkerhet er definert.
PIA_ORG_ORG.name: Organisering
PIA_ORG_ORG.description: Spesifiser om det er en person (for eksempel personvernombud) som er ansvarlig for overholdelse av lover og forskrifter for personvern. Spesifiser også om det er en rådgivendegruppe som er ansvarlig for å følge opp aktiviteter rundt personvern.

PIA_ORG_POL.placeholder: Beskriv styringssystemet for personvern og informasjonssikkerhet.
PIA_ORG_POL.name: Styringssystem
PIA_ORG_POL.description: Beskriv viktige retningslinjer, proedyrer og rutiner som inngår i styringssystemet for personvern og informasjonssikkerhet (risiko, hovedprinsipper må følges, angrepsmål, regler som skal følges osv.) og hvem man kommuniserer med (brukere, IT-avdeling, ledelsen, revisjon, osv.).

PIA_ORG_RMGT.placeholder: Beskriv prosessene for kontroll av risiko, i forhold til personvern og informasjonssikkerhet for den registrerte, som oppstår som følge av behandlingsaktivitetenen i virksomheten.
PIA_ORG_RMGT.name: Håndtering av personvernrisiko
PIA_ORG_RMGT.description: Prosedyre som beskriver prosessene for kontroll av risiko, i forhold til personvern og datasikkerhet for den registrerte, som oppstår som følge av behandlingsaktiviteten i virksomheten (utarbeide et risikokart, osv.).

PIA_ORG_PBD.placeholder: Beskriv hvordan personvern er innarbeidet i prosjekter
PIA_ORG_PBD.name: Innarbeide personvern i prosjekter
PIA_ORG_PBD.description: Etabler prosedyrer for å innarbeide sikring av personopplysninger i alle nye behandlingsprosesser.

PIA_ORG_VIOL.placeholder: Angi om IKT-hendelser er underlagt prosedyrer som er dokumenterte og testet.
PIA_ORG_VIOL.name: Håndtering av brudd på personopplysnigssikkerheten
PIA_ORG_VIOL.description: Finnes det en operativ gruppe eller avdeling som kan oppdage og behandle hendelser som kan påvirke den registrertes rettigheter og friheter.
PIA_ORG_VIOL.source: PIAF Connected Objects p24 and PIA3 p36 - WIKI

PIA_ORG_PERS.placeholder: Angi hvilke kontrolltiltak som er innført for å bevisstgjøre ansatte.
PIA_ORG_PERS.name: Personalledelse
PIA_ORG_PERS.description: Finnes det prosedyrer som beskriver bevisstgjøring av betydningen for personvern og informasjonssikkerhet, av nyansatte, ansatte og ansatte som slutter.

PIA_ORG_EXT.placeholder: Angi hvilke sikkerhetskontroller og avtaler som er utarbeidet for databehandlere som har behov for tilgang til personopplysniger.
PIA_ORG_EXT.name: Forhold til tredjepart
PIA_ORG_EXT.description: Finnes det prosedyrer og prosesser for å redusere risikoen som lovlig tilgang fra tredjepart kan representere i forhold til dem registrertes rettigheter og friheter.

PIA_ORG_AUD.placeholder: Angi om det er overvåkning av effekt og tilstrekkelighet av personverntiltakene.
PIA_ORG_AUD.name: Tilsyn
PIA_ORG_AUD.description: Finnes det prosedyrer og prosesser som gjør virksomheten i stand til å administrere og kontrollere at personvernet i behandlingen ivaretas.

PIA_DEF_EXA.name: Datakvalitet
PIA_DEF_EXA.description:
Persondata skal være korrekte og oppdaterte. Alle nødvendig tiltak skal umiddelbart igangsettes for å slette eller korrigere data som ikke er korrekte (‘accuracy’).
Se art. 5.1 d) of [GDPR]

PIA_DEF_MES.name: Målinger
PIA_DEF_MES.description: Velg blant de som er tilgjenglig i avsnittet "Planlagte eller eksisterende målinger av innførte tiltak i forhold til hensikt/formål", som bør kompletteres ved behov.

PIA_DEF_RT.name: Behandlingsansvarlig
PIA_DEF_RT.description:
En fysisk eller juridisk person, en offentlig myndighet, en institusjon eller ethvert annet organ som alene eller sammen med andre bestemmer formålet med behandlingen av personopplysninger og hvilke midler som skal benyttes; når formålet med og midlene for behandlingen er fastsatt i unionsretten eller i medlemsstatenes nasjonale rett, kan den behandlingsansvarlige, eller de særlige kriteriene for utpeking av vedkommende, fastsettes i unionsretten eller i medlemsstatenes nasjonale rett.
Se art. 4.7 i [GDPR]

PIA_DEF_DCP.name: Personopplysninger
PIA_DEF_DCP.description:
Enhver opplysning om en identifisert eller identifiserbar fysisk person («den registrerte»); en identifiserbar fysisk person er en person som direkte eller indirekte kan identifiseres, særlig ved hjelp av en identifikator, f.eks. et navn, et identifikasjonsnummer, lokaliseringsopplysninger, en nettidentifikator eller ett eller flere elementer som er spesifikke for nevnte fysiske persons fysiske, fysiologiske, genetiske, psykiske, økonomiske, kulturelle eller sosiale identitet.
Se art. 4.1 i [GDPR]

PIA_DEF_DEST.name: Mottaker
PIA_DEF_DEST.description:
En fysisk eller juridisk person, offentlig myndighet, institusjon eller ethvert annet organ som personopplysninger utleveres til, enten det dreier seg om en tredjepart eller ikke. Offentlige myndigheter som kan motta personopplysninger innenfor rammen av en særskilt undersøkelse i samsvar med unionsretten eller medlemsstatenes nasjonale rett, skal imidlertid ikke anses som mottakere; nevnte offentlige myndigheters behandling av slike opplysninger skal være i samsvar med gjeldende regler om vern av personopplysninger i henhold til formålet med behandlingen.
Se Art. 4.9 i [GDPR]

PIA_DEF_SUPT.name: Supporting assets
PIA_DEF_SUPT.description: Asset on which personal data rely. This may be hardware, software, networks, people, paper or paper transmission channels

PIA_DEF_MINC.name: Minimising the amount of personal data
PIA_DEF_MINC.description: Reduce the severity of risks by limiting the amount of personal data to what is strictly necessary to achieve a defined purpose, otherwise the data shall be not collected.

PIA_DEF_CONS.name: Consent
PIA_DEF_CONS.description:
Any freely given, specific, informed and unambiguous indication of the data subject's wishes by which he or she, by a statement or by a clear affirmative action, signifies agreement to the processing of personal data relating to him or her.
See Art. 4.10 of [GDPR]

PIA_DEF_ACC.name: Right of access
PIA_DEF_ACC.description: The data subject shall have the right to obtain from the controller confirmation as to whether or not personal data concerning him or her are being processed, and, where that is the case, access to the personal data and the information described in Art. 15 of [GDPR]

PIA_DEF_PORT.name: Right to data portability
PIA_DEF_PORT.description: The data subject shall have the right to receive the personal data concerning him or her, which he or she has provided to a controller, in a structured, commonly used and machine-readable format and have the right to transmit those data to another controller without hindrance from the controller to which the personal data have been provided, see Art. 20 of [GDPR]

PIA_DEF_RECT.name: Right to rectification
PIA_DEF_RECT.description: The data subject shall have the right to obtain from the controller without undue delay the rectification of inaccurate personal data concerning him or her. Taking into account the purposes of the processing, the data subject shall have the right to have incomplete personal data completed, including by means of providing a supplementary statement.

PIA_DEF_EFF.name: Right to erasure
PIA_DEF_EFF.description: The data subject shall have the right to obtain from the controller the erasure of personal data concerning him or her without undue delay and the controller shall have the obligation to erase personal data without undue delay, see Art. 17 of [GDPR]

PIA_DEF_LIM.name: Right to restricting of processing
PIA_DEF_LIM.description: The data subject shall have the right to obtain from the controller restriction of processing, see Art. 18 of [GDPR]

PIA_DEF_OPP.name: Right to object
PIA_DEF_OPP.description: The data subject shall have the right to object, on grounds relating to his or her particular situation, at any time to processing of personal data concerning him or her, pursuant to Art. 21 of [GDPR]

PIA_DEF_PSEU.name: Pseudonymisation
PIA_DEF_PSEU.description:
Processing of personal data in such a manner that the personal data can no longer be attributed to a specific data subject without the use of additional information, provided that such additional information is kept separately and is subject to technical and organisational measures to ensure that the personal data are not attributed to an identified or identifiable natural person.
Pseudonymisation reduces the linkability of a dataset with the original identity of a data subject; as such, it is a useful security measure but not a method of anonymisation.
PIA_DEF_PSEU.source: GDPR Art. 4.5 and guidelines G29 p22 http://ec.europa.eu/justice/data-protection/article-29/documentation/opinion-recommendation/files/2014/wp216_en.pdf

PIA_DEF_CLO.name: Data partitioning
PIA_DEF_CLO.description: Data organisation methods that reduce the possibility that personal data can be correlated and that a breach of all personal data may occur. For instance, by identifying the personal data useful only to each business process and logically separating them.

PIA_DEF_CTLA.name: Logical access controls
PIA_DEF_CTLA.description:
Means implemented to limit the risks that unauthorized persons will access personal data electronically, it requires among other things to :
- manage users' profiles by separating tasks and areas of responsibility (preferably in centralised fashion) to limit access to personal data exclusively to authorised users by applying need-to-know and least-privilege principles;
- withdraw the rights of employees, contracting parties and other third parties when they are no longer authorised to access a premises or a resource or when their employment contract ends.

PIA_DEF_MIN1.name: Filtering and removal
PIA_DEF_MIN1.description:
When data are being imported, different types of metadata (such as EXIF data with an image file attached) can unintentionally be collected.
Such metadata must be identified and eliminated if they are unnecessary for the purposes specified.

PIA_DEF_MIN2.name: Reducing sensitivity via conversion
PIA_DEF_MIN2.description:
Once sensitive data have been received, as part of a series of general information or transmitted for statistical purposes only, these can be converted into a less sensitive form or pseudonymised. For example :
- if the system collects the IP address to determine the user's location for a statistical purpose, the IP address can be deleted once the city or district has been deduced
- if the system receives video data from surveillance cameras, it can recognise people who are standing or moving in the scene and blur them
- if the system is a smart meter, it can aggregate the use of energy over a certain period, without recording it in real time

PIA_DEF_SRC.name: Risk source
PIA_DEF_SRC.description: Person or non-human source that can cause a risk. This source may act accidentally or deliberately.

PIA_DEF_MEN.name: Threat
PIA_DEF_MEN.description: Procedure comprising one or more individual actions on data supporting assets. It is used, intentionally or otherwise, by risk sources and may cause a feared event.

PIA_DEF_MENA.name: Threats that can lead to an illegitimate access
PIA_DEF_MENA.description:
Threats regarding: - Hardware, used inappropriately, observed, altered, lost (use or transportation of sensitive hardware for personal purposes, watching a person's screen without their knowledge while on the train, tracking by a hardware-based key logger, etc.)
- Software, used inappropriately, observed, altered (raising of privileges, collection of configuration data, infection by malicious code, etc.)
- Computer channels observed (Interception of Ethernet traffic, etc.)
- People, observed, manipulated, lost (Unintentional disclosure of information, social engineering, assignment changes)
- Paper documents observed, lost (reading, theft of mail, etc.)
- Paper transmission channels observed (reading of signature books in circulation, etc.)

PIA_DEF_MENM.name: Threats that can lead to an unwanted modification of personal data
PIA_DEF_MENM.description:
Threats regarding :
- Hardware altered (addition of incompatible hardware resulting in malfunctions, removal of essential components, etc.)
- Software used inappropriately or altered (Unwanted modifications to data in databases, operator errors that modify data, etc.)
- Computer channels used inappropriately (resending of intercepted data, etc.)
- People overloaded or manipulates (assignment of staff to tasks beyond their abilities, stress or negative changes in working conditions, influence, etc.)
- Paper documents that have been altered (changes to figures in a file, replacement of an original by a forgery, etc.)
- Paper transmission channels that have been altered (change from one signature book to another, sending of multiple conflicting documents, etc.)
PIA_DEF_MENM.source: PIAF Connected Objects p43 and 44, WIKI

PIA_DEF_MENI.name: Threats that can lead to a disappearance of personal data
PIA_DEF_MENI.description:
Threats regarding :
- Hardware : used inappropriately, overloaded, altered, damaged, lost (storage unit full, processing capacity overload, addition of incompatible hardware resulting in malfunctions, fire, theft or loss of an asset, etc.)
- Software : used inappropriately, overloaded, altered, damaged, lost (erasure of data, exceeding of database size, logic bomb, non-renewal of the licence for software used to access data, etc.)
- Computer channels : overloaded, altered, lost (unauthorised downloading, loss of Internet connection, etc.)
- People : overloaded, damaged, lost (poor use of skills, disease, retirement, etc.)
- Paper documents : used inappropriately, damaged, lost (erasure, aging of archived documents, theft or loss of documents, etc.)
- Paper transmission channels : overloaded, damaged, altered, lost (mail delivery halted by a strike, reassignment of offices or premises, loss of a document delivery company, reorganisation of paper transmission channels, etc.)
PIA_DEF_MENI.source: PIAF Connected Objects p44 and 45, WIKI

PIA_DEF_GRV.name: Severity
PIA_DEF_GRV.description: Severity represents the magnitude of a risk. It primarily depends on the prejudicial nature of the potential impacts.

PIA_DEF_VRA.name: Likelihood
PIA_DEF_VRA.description: Likelihood expresses the possibility of a risk occurring. It primarily depends on the level of vulnerabilities of the supporting assets when under threat and the level of capabilities of the risk sources to exploit them.

PIA_DEF_PBDS.name: Project Management
PIA_DEF_PBDS.description: Measures taken to integrate the protection of personal data in all new processing operations (trusted names, guidelines, CNIL methodology for risk management or other internal methodology).

PIA_DEF_VIOL.name: Personal data breach
PIA_DEF_VIOL.description: Breach of security leading to the accidental or unlawful destruction, loss, alteration, unauthorised disclosure of, or access to, personal data transmitted, stored or otherwise processed.

PIA_VAL_CART.name: Mapping of risks
PIA_VAL_CART.description: Graph illustrating the good security practices, with a conformity value attributed to each on the basis of its assessment in previous steps.

PIA_VAL_ACT.name: Action plan
PIA_VAL_ACT.description: corrective controls suggested by the assessor in previous steps, drawing up an action plan setting out, for each action, its manager, frequency, difficulty, cost and progress.

PIA_DEF_ENJ.name: Stakes
PIA_DEF_ENJ.description: Expected benefits (for the organisation, for the data subjects, for society in general, etc.).

PIA_DEF_ST.name: Processor
PIA_DEF_ST.description:
Natural or legal person, public authority, agency or other body which processes personal data on behalf of the controller, see Art. 4.8 of [GDPR].
The processor and any person acting under the authority of the controller or of the processor, who has access to personal data, shall not process those data except on instructions from the controller, unless required to do so by Union or Member State law, see Art. 29 of [GDPR].

PIA_DEF_RGPD.name: GDPR (General Data Protection Regulation
PIA_DEF_RGPD.description: Regulation on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC.

PIA_DEF_PC.name: Data subject
PIA_DEF_PC.description: Persons to whom the data covered by the processing relate.

PIA_DEF_MIN3.name: Reducing the identifying nature of data
PIA_DEF_MIN3.description:
The system can ensure that:
- the user can use a resource or service without the risk of disclosing his/her identity (anonymous data)
- the user can use a resource or service without the risk of disclosing his/her identity, but remain identifiable and responsible for this use (pseudonymous data)
- the user can make multiple uses of resources or services without the risk of these different uses being linked together (data cannot be correlated)
- the user can use a resource or service without the risk of others, third parties in particular, being able to observe that the resource or service is being used (non-observability)
The choice of a method from the list above must be made on the basis of the threats identified. For some types of threat to privacy, pseudonymization will be more appropriate than anonymisation (for example, if there is a traceability need). In addition, some threats to privacy will be addressed using a combination of methods.

PIA_DEF_MIN4.name: Reducing data accumulation
PIA_DEF_MIN4.description: The system can be organised into independent parts with separate access control functions. The data can also be divided between these independent sub-systems and controlled by each sub-system using different access control mechanisms. If a sub-system is compromised, the impacts on all of the data can thus be reduced.

PIA_DEF_MIN5.name: Restricting data access
PIA_DEF_MIN5.description: The system can limit data access according to the "need to know" principle. The system can separate the sensitive data and apply specific access control policies. The system can also encrypt sensitive data to protect their confidentiality during transmission and storage. Access to temporary cookies which are produced during the data processing must also be protected.

PIA_EX_DCPC.name: Common personal data
PIA_EX_DCPC.description:
Identification data : Civil status, identity, age, etc.
Personal life : living habits, marital status, etc.
Professional life : résumé, education and professional training, awards, etc.
Connection data : IP addresses, event logs, etc.
Location data : travels, GPS data, GSM data, etc.
Others : phone number, email address, etc.

PIA_EX_DCPS.name: Personal data perceived as sensitive
PIA_EX_DCPS.description: Social security number (NIR), biometric data, bank data

PIA_EX_DCPR.name: Convictions and sensitive personal data
PIA_EX_DCPR.description: Philosophical, political, religious and trade-union views, sex life, health data, racial or ethnic origin, data concerning health or sex life, offenses, convictions, security measures, see Art. 9 and 10 of [GDPR].
PIA_EX_DCPR.source: PIA2 old version, GDPR Article 9 and 10 - WIKI

PIA_EX_HUMI.name: Internal human sources
PIA_EX_HUMI.description:
It could be either:
- a negligent or rogue employee, proximity of the system, skills, privileges and available time are potentially high, possible lack of training and awareness
- negligent or rogue user, family member or friend having access to the service.
Various motives are possible, including : clumsiness, error, negligence game, malicious intent, revenge, spying

PIA_EX_HUME.name: External human sources
PIA_EX_HUME.description:
It could be either:
- a rogue or naive neighbor, by having a physical proximity, hacking into the device's data;
- a hacker targeting a user by using the knowledge he/she has of the user and some of the information concerning him/her;
- a hacker targeting one of the companies by using the knowledge he/she has of the companies that can undermine their image;
- an authorised third party company using its privileged access to illegitimately access information.

PIA_EX_NHUM.name: Non-human sources
PIA_EX_NHUM.description: Incident or damage at one of the organisation (power cut, fire, flood, etc.)

PIA_EX_IMPN.name: Negligible impact
PIA_EX_IMPN.description:
Data subjects either will not be affected or may encounter a few inconveniences, which they will overcome without any problem. For example:
- physical : transient headaches;
- material : loss of time in repeating formalities or waiting for them to be fulfilled, receipt of unsolicited mail (e.g.: spams), reuse of data published on websites for the purpose of targeted advertising , etc.;
- moral : mere annoyance, feeling of invasion of privacy without real or objective harm (commercial intrusion), etc.

PIA_EX_IMPL.name: Limited impact
PIA_EX_IMPL.description:
Data subjects may encounter significant inconveniences, which they will be able to overcome despite a few difficulties. For example:
- physical : minor physical ailments (minor illness due to disregard of contraindications), defamation resulting in physical or psychological retaliation, etc.;
- material : unanticipated payments (fines imposed erroneously), denial of access to administrative or commercial services, receipt of unsolicited targeted mailings likely to damage the reputation of data subjects, etc.;
- moral : minor but objective psychological ailments, feeling of invasion of privacy without irreversible damage, intimidation on social networks, etc.

PIA_EX_IMPI.name: Significant impact
PIA_EX_IMPI.description:
Data subjects may encounter significant consequences, which they should be able to overcome albeit with real and serious difficulties. For example:
- physical : serious physical ailments causing long-term harm (worsening of health due to improper care, or disregard of contraindications), lteration of physical integrity for example following an assault, an accident at home, work, etc.
- material : misappropriation of money not compensated, targeted, unique and non-recurring, lost opportunities (home loan, refusal of studies, internships or employment, examination ban), loss of housing, loss of employment, etc.;
- moral : serious psychological ailments (depression, development of a phobia), feeling of invasion of privacy with irreversible damage, victim of blackmailing, cyberbullying and harassment, etc.

PIA_EX_IMPM.name: Maximum impact
PIA_EX_IMPM.description:
Data subjects may encounter significant, or even irreversible, consequences, which they may not overcome. For example:
- physical : long-term or permanent physical ailments, permanent impairment of physical integrity, death;
- material : financial risk, substantial debts, inability to work, inability to relocate, loss of evidence in the context of litigation, loss of access to vital infrastructure (water, electricity), etc.
- moral : long-term or permanent psychological ailments, criminal penalty, abduction, loss of family ties, inability to sue, change of administrative status and/or loss of legal autonomy (guardianship), etc.

PIA_EX_VRAN.name: Negligible likelihood
PIA_EX_VRAN.description: It does not seem possible for the selected risk sources to materialize the threat by exploiting the properties of supporting assets (e.g.: theft of paper documents stored in a room protected by a badge reader and access code).

PIA_EX_VRAL.name: Limited likelihood
PIA_EX_VRAL.description: It seems difficult for the selected risk sources to materialize the threat by exploiting the properties of supporting assets (e.g.: theft of paper documents stored in a room protected by a badge reader).

PIA_EX_VRAI.name: Significant likelihood
PIA_EX_VRAI.description: It seems possible for the selected risk sources to materialize the threat by exploiting the properties of supporting assets (e.g.: theft of paper documents stored in offices that cannot be accessed without first checking in at the reception).

PIA_EX_VRAM.name: Maximum likelihood
PIA_EX_VRAM.description: It seems extremely easy for the selected risk sources to materialize the threat by exploiting the properties of supporting assets (e.g.: theft of paper documents stored in the public lobby).

PIA_EX_MIND.name: Minimisation of data themselves
PIA_EX_MIND.description: Reduce the severity of risks by minimising the data themselves, by taking measures aimed at reducing their sensitivity.

PIA_DEF_ANO.name: Anonymisation
PIA_DEF_ANO.description: Process removing the identifying characteristics from personal data. To assess the robustness of an anonymisation processes, see the WP29 guidelines.

PIA_SEC_CTR.placeholder: Describe here specific measures for processors (host, maintenance company, administrator, specialist service providers, etc.)
PIA_SEC_CTR.name: Processing contracts
PIA_SEC_CTR.source: Mesures_US Procurement: identified and governed by a contract

PIA_DEF_CHIF.name: Encryption
PIA_DEF_CHIF.description: Measure making personal data unintelligible to anyone without access authorization (symmetric or asymmetric encryption, use of public algorithms known to be strong, authentication certificate, etc.).

PIA_DEF_PWD.name: Password
PIA_DEF_PWD.description: Passwords shall be composed of a minimum of eight characters; must be renewed if there is the least concern that they may have been compromised and, possibly, periodically (every six months or once a year) and must include a minimum of three of the four kinds of characters (capital letters, lower case letters, numerals and special characters); when a password is changed, the last five passwords may not be reused; the same password should not be used for different accesses; passwords should not be related to one's personal information (including name or date of birth.). Define a maximum number of attempts beyond which a warning is issued and authentication is blocked (temporarily or until it is manually unblocked).

PIA_DEF_AUTH.name: Authentication
PIA_DEF_AUTH.description: Every person with legitimate access to personal data (employees, contracting parties and other third parties) should be identified by a unique identifier. Choose an authentication method to open sessions that is appropriate to the context, the risk level and the robustness expected. Recommendations: if the risks are not elevated, a password may be used; however, if the risks are higher, use a one-time password token but change the default activation password, or, when part of the password is sent by SMS, a card with a PIN code, an electronic certificate or any other form of strong authentication.

PIA_DEF_LOG.name: Surveillance
PIA_DEF_LOG.description: Set up a logging architecture to allow early detection of incidents involving personal data and to have information that can be used to analyze them or provide proof in connection with investigations.

PIA_DEF_ARCH.name: Archiving
PIA_DEF_ARCH.description: Procedures preserving and managing the electronic archives containing the personal data intended to ensure their value (specifically, their legal value) throughout the entire period necessary (transfer, storage, migration, accessibility, elimination, archiving policy, protection of confidentiality, etc.).

evaluations.title: Evaluation
evaluations.placeholder_to_correct: TO BE TRANSLATED - The information provided are not sufficient to properly evaluate them. Send back to the editor to improve the original submission.
evaluations.placeholder_improvable1: TO BE TRANSLATED - According to the available information, additional measures are to be implemented in order to improve the data protection of the processing.
evaluations.placeholder_improvable2: TO BE TRANSLATED - Enter your comments.
evaluations.placeholder_acceptable: TO BE TRANSLATED - According to the available information, the measures implemented are adequate to properly meet the requirements for protecting the data.

gauges.seriousness: Taking into account the action plan, how do you re-evaluate the seriousness of this risk ({{value}})?
gauges.likelihood: Taking into account the action plan, how do you re-evaluate the likelihood of this risk ({{value}})?

qa1.title: I get display issues such as icons being stuck in one state or missing elements from the interface
qa1.content: When encountering those display issues, close the application and reload it. It usually fixes the issue. You won’t lose the information you have entered ; it is  automatically saved as you type.

qa2.title: I can’t edit the gauges for evaluating the severity and likelihood of a risk
qa2.content: This known issue is currently being fixed. If you encounter this problem, we recommend that you fill in the justification field of the estimated level of severity and / or likelihood. You will be able to edit the gauge once the bug is fixed.

qa3.title: I encounter issues when importing a PIA
qa3.content: Several bugs have been observed when importing a PIA, and in particular the level gauges for evaluating the severity and likelihood of a risk may disappear. In this case, please refer to the above mentioned issue. Besides, a PIA may not appear on the dashboard after importing it. This is a display issue and you just need to refresh the page.

qa4.title: When I copy / paste text, it is highlighted.
qa4.content: This is only a display bug and it has no effect on the text you enter in a field. This visual problem will be fixed soon.

qa5.title: I can’t evaluate a section
qa5.content: In order to evaluate a section, it is mandatory to fill in all the fields. Please check if this is the case. When editing a risk, you must have at least one technical or organizational measure that mitigates the risk in order to ask for an evaluation of the risk.

qa6.title: When switching language, the texts are not translated
qa6.content: Please close the PIA you are editing and re-open it. The content should then be displayed in the language you have selected.

qa7.title: I have refused to validate a PIA but I don’t know what to do now
qa7.content: For the moment, the navigation menu icons are not refreshed after refusing a PIA. You have to check each section and change the information and/or evaluation according to the reasons for refusing the PIA. Once all section have been reviewed, you should be able to request PIA validation again.

about.title: About the Tool PIA
about.description:
This tool is originally designed by the Commission Nationale Informatique et Liberté (CNIL), the French Data Protection Authority, to help data processor to be compliant with the GDPR.
This software is free and open. If you wish to get involved in this project, you are welcome to download the source code from Github, modify it and share it with the community.
about.translators: The PIA software is currently available in five languages. The French and English versions are provided by the CNIL. The others versions result from the contributions of the following individuals:
about.translators_name:
• Dutch: Ruud van Driel, Manuel d’Orso ;
  • Czech: Jiří Grohmann, Manuel d’Orso ;
  • Italian: Manuel d’Orso, Gianluca Markos ;
  • Polish: Joanna Karczewska.
about.contribute: If you wish to contribute to the translation of the software in another language or improve the existing translations, we recommend you to read this page describing the steps to follow.

settings.title: Settings
settings.content: Please, provide the address (URL) of the remote server:

validation_page.responsible: TO BE TRANSLATED - Person accountable for validating the PIA:
validation_page.after_reading: TO BE TRANSLATED - After reading full PIA relating to the data processing linked to
validation_page.confirmation1: TO BE TRANSLATED - I attest that the context of the processing described in the PIA is consistent with the reality.
validation_page.confirmation2: TO BE TRANSLATED - I attest that I am aware of the risks depending on the existing or planned measures.
validation_page.confirmation3: TO BE TRANSLATED - I ratify the corrective actions indicated in the action plan.
validation_page.confirmation4: TO BE TRANSLATED - I commit to implement as quickly as possible the indicated corrective actions.
validation_page.mandatory_fields: TO BE TRANSLATED - All boxes must be checked
validation_page.waiting_for_signature: TO BE TRANSLATED - Pending signed PIA
validation_page.add_signed_pia: TO BE TRANSLATED - Add the signed PIA
validation_page.remove_attachment: TO BE TRANSLATED - Remove the attachment
validation_page.latest_signed_attachment: TO BE TRANSLATED - Last signed attachment
validation_page.signed_attachments_history: TO BE TRANSLATED - Signed attachments history

rejection_page.title: TO BE TRANSLATED - Validation history
rejection_page.rejection_reason_placeholder: TO BE TRANSLATED - Describe the reasons for refusing the PIA.
rejection_page.applied_adjustments_placeholder: TO BE TRANSLATED - Describe the changes brought to the PIA.

button.send_for_validation: TO BE TRANSLATED - Resend for approval

completed_edition.content: TO BE TRANSLATED - The PIA has been fully edited, it has to be reviewed.

completed_evaluation.content: TO BE TRANSLATED - The PIA has been fully reviewed, it has to be validated.

update_server_url.content: The server address has been updated.

signed_pia_validation.content:
The PIA is accepted
Finalize the validation of the PIA by attaching
the signed report by the person in charge.

Are you sure you want to
give up this treatment?

Rejected PIA,
Several fields must be corrected.
Return to evaluation mode
to make corrections.

Warning,
Please enter a comment different from the last recorded.

Warning,
At least one measure must be filled: no deletion possible.

remove_measure.content:

Are you sure you want to
remove this measure?

TO BE TRANSLATED - Congratulations,
you've finished evaluating this section.
Others parts of the PIA has to be evaluated as well in order to be able to validate the PIA.

validate_evaluation_to_correct.content:
Sorry,
Several fields must be corrected.
Return to edition mode
to make corrections.

Sorry,
before evaluating risks,
you must report the
existing or planned measures.

summary.title: PIA information

content_choice.0: The treatment should not be used.

summary.concerned_people_unsearched_opinion_comm: Reason why concerned people opinion wasn't requested

errors.title: Page not found.
errors.content:
If you encounter other problems or if you have suggestions for improvement,
you can send them back via this form: https://www.cnil.fr/fr/webform/vos-retours-sur-loutil-pia

opinions.placeholder_dpo_opinion: Specify the reasons for your choice.
opinions.dpo_lock: Please complete the other sections before you can fill the DPO opinion.
opinions.placeholder_people_opinion: Describe how the opinions were collected and what the analysis is. If the notices have not been sought, state the reasons.
opinions.placeholder_search_content: Justify the reason why the opinion of the persons concerned has not been requested.
opinions.treatment_nok: The treatment should not be used.
opinions.treatment_lock: Please complete the other sections before you can fill the opinions of the persons concerned.

1.title: Context
1.short_help: This section gives you a clear view of the treatment(s) of personal data in question.

1.title: Overview
1.short_help: This part allows you to identify and present the object of the study.

1.title: Which is the processing under consideration?
1.placeholder: Present a brief outline of the processing: its name, purposes, stakes, context of use, etc.

2.title: What are the responsibilities linked to the processing?
2.placeholder: Describe the responsabilities of the stakeholders: the data controller, the possible data processors and joint controllers.

3.title: Are there standards applicable to the processing?
3.placeholder: List the relevant standards applicable to the processing, especially approved codes of conduct and data protection certifications.

2.title: Data, processes and supporting assets
2.short_help: This part allows you to define and describe the scope of the processing in detail.

1.title: What are the data processed?
1.placeholder: List the data collected and processed. Define for each the storage durations, the recipients and persons with access thereto.

2.title: How does the life cycle of data and processes work?
2.placeholder: Present and describe how the product generally works (from the data collection to the data destruction, the different processing stages, storage, etc.), using for example a diagram of data flows (add it as an attachment) and a detailed description of the processes carried out.

3.title: What are the data supporting assets?
3.placeholder: List the data supporting assets (operating systems, business applications, database management systems, office suites, protocols, configurations, etc.)

2.title: Fundamental principles
2.short_help: This section allows you to build the compliance framework for privacy principles.

1.title: Proportionality and necessity
1.short_help: This part allows you to demonstrate the legitimacy of your treatment and of the data processed.

1.title: Are the processing purposes specified, explicit and legitimate?
1.placeholder: Explain why the processing purposes are specified, explicit and legitimate.

2.title: What are the legal basis making the processing lawful?
2.placeholder: Describe what is/are the legal basis of your processing (ex: consent, performance of a contract, compliance with a legal obligation, protecting the vital intests, etc.)

3.title: Are the data collected adequate, relevant and limited to what is necessary in relation to the purposes for which they are processed ('data minimisation')?
3.placeholder: Explain why each of the data collected is necessary for the purposes of your processing.

4.title: Are the data accurate and kept up to date?
4.placeholder: Describe which are the steps taken to ensure the quality of the data.

5.title: What are the storage duration of the data?
5.placeholder: Explain why the storage durations are justified by legal requirements and/or processing needs.

2.title: Controls to protect the personal rights of data subjects
2.short_help: This part allows you to demonstrate that you are implementing the necessary means to enable the persons concerned to exercise their rights.

1.title: How are the data subjects informed on the processing?
1.placeholder: Describe what is the information given to the data subjects and what are the means to do it.

2.title: If applicable, how is the consent of data subjects obtained?
2.placeholder: Describe the controls intended to ensure that users' consent has been obtained.

3.title: How can data subjects exercise their rights of access and to data portability?
3.short_title: Right of access and to data portability
3.placeholder: Describe the controls intended for enabling data subjects to access, receive and transmit their data.

4.title: How can data subjects exercise their rights to rectification and erasure?
4.placeholder: Describe the controls intended for enabling data subjects to rectify and erase their data.

5.title: How can data subjects exercise their rights to restriction and to object?
5.short_title: Right to restriction and to object
5.placeholder: Describe the controls intended for enabling data subjects to restrict and to object to the processing of their data.

6.title: Are the obligations of the processors clearly identified and governed by a contract?
6.placeholder: For each processor, describe his responsibilities (duration, scope, purpose, documented processing instructions, prior authorisation) and provide the contracts, codes of conduct and certifications determining its missions and obligations.

7.title: In the case of data transfer outside the European Union, are the data adequately protected?
7.placeholder: For each country outside the European Union where data are stored or processed, name it and tell if it is acknowledged as offering an adequate level of data protection or describe the provisions concerning the transfer.

3.title: Risks
3.short_help: This section allows you to assess the privacy risks, taking into account existing or planned controls.

1.title: Planned or existing measures
1.short_help: This section allows you to identify controls (existing or planned) that contribute to data security.

2.title: Illegitimate access to data
2.short_help: Analyze the causes and consequences of illegitimate access to data, and estimate its severity and likelihood.

1.title: What could be the main impacts on the data subjects if the risk were to occur?

2.title: What are the main threats that could lead to the risk?

4.title: Which of the identified controls contribute to addressing the risk?
4.placeholder: Click to select controls which address the risk.

5.title: How do you estimate the risk severity, especially according to potential impacts and planned controls?
5.placeholder: Justify here the estimated severity of the risk.

6.title: How do you estimate the likelihood of the risk, especially in respect of threats, sources of risk and planned controls?

3.title: Unwanted modification of data
3.short_help: Analyze the causes and consequences of an undesired change in data, and estimate its seriousness and likelihood.

1.title: What could be the main impacts on the data subjects if the risk were to occur?

2.title: What are the main threats that could lead to the risk?

4.title: Which of the identified controls contribute to addressing the risk?
4.placeholder: Click here to select controls which address the risk.

5.title: How do you estimate the risk severity, especially according to potential impacts and planned controls?
5.placeholder: Justify here the estimated severity of the risk.

6.title: How do you estimate the likelihood of the risk, especially in respect of threats, sources of risk and planned controls?

4.title: Data disappearance
4.short_help: Analyze the causes and consequences of data loss, and estimate its seriousness and likelihood.

1.title: What could be the main impacts on the data subjects if the risk were to occur?

2.title: What are the main threats that could lead to the risk?

4.title: Which of the identified controls contribute to addressing the risk?
4.placeholder: Click here to select controls which address the risk.

5.title: How do you estimate the risk severity, especially according to potential impacts and planned controls?
5.placeholder: Justify here the estimated severity of the risk.

6.title: How do you estimate the likelihood of the risk, especially in respect of threats, sources of risk and planned controls?

5.title: Risks overview
5.short_help: This visualisation allows you to have a global and synthetic view on the controls effects on the risks they address.

4.title: Validation
4.short_help: This section allows you to prepare and formalise the PIA validation.

1.title: Risk mapping
1.short_help: This visualisation allows you to compare the positioning of the risks between them, before and after application of the complementary controls.

2.title: Action plan
2.short_help: Plan in detail the implementation of the additional controls identified during the PIA. The action plan is automatically updated when evaluating the different elements comprised in the PIA.

3.title: DPO and concerned persons opinions
3.short_help: Present the advice of the person in charge of data protection and privacy issues (data protection delegate if there is one). Present the views of the data subjects or their representatives.

4.title: TO BE TRANSLATED - Validate the PIA
